<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Focused Fascination](/Feats.aspx?ID=6131) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Swashbuckler" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=825" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 163 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Lion Blade](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=319) (Level 4)

**Prerequisites**
[Fascinating Performance](/Feats.aspx?ID=5147)

</column>

---

When you use Fascinating Performance in a combat encounter, you need only a success, rather than a critical success, to [fascinate](/Conditions.aspx?ID=72) your target. This works only if you're attempting to fascinate one target. For example, if you were an expert in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45), you could choose to target multiple creatures normally or target one creature and fascinate it on a success.
name: Focused Fascination
